alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor; Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 4:31AM PST until December 07 at 11:31PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Thurston and Grays Harbor Counties. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The upper reaches of the Chehalis River crested overnight. The flood crest will move downstream reaching Grand Mound tonight and Porter on Thursday. The Newaukum River will crest this morning with the river dropping back below flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River above Grand Mound. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 141.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Thurston County will flood several roads in Independence Valley including James Road, Independence Road, and Moon road. Flood waters will also cover nearby farm lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 141.3 feet. - Flood stage is 141.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest near 142.3 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
